00050 #include "FeasibleNewton.hpp"

00057 std::string FeasibleNewton::get_name() const { return "FeasibleNewton"; }
00058   
00059 PatchSet* FeasibleNewton::get_patch_set()
00060   { return PatchSetUser::get_patch_set(); }
00061 
00062 FeasibleNewton::FeasibleNewton(ObjectiveFunction* of)
00063   : VertexMover(of), 
00064     PatchSetUser(true),
00065     convTol(1e-6),
00066     coordsMem(0),
00067     havePrintedDirectionMessage(false)
00068 {
00069   TerminationCriterion* default_crit=get_inner_termination_criterion();
00070   default_crit->add_absolute_gradient_L2_norm( 5e-5 );
00071 }  
00072   
00073 
00074 void FeasibleNewton::initialize(PatchData &pd, MsqError &err)
00075 {
00076   // Cannot do anything.  Variable sizes with maximum size dependent
00077   // upon the entire MeshSet.
00078   coordsMem = pd.create_vertices_memento(err); MSQ_CHKERR(err);
00079   havePrintedDirectionMessage = false;
00080 }
00081 
00082 void FeasibleNewton::initialize_mesh_iteration(PatchData &pd, MsqError &/*err*/)
00083 {
00084   pd.reorder();
00085 }
00086 
00087 void FeasibleNewton::optimize_vertex_positions(PatchData &pd, 
00088                                                MsqError &err)
00089 {
00090   MSQ_FUNCTION_TIMER( "FeasibleNewton::optimize_vertex_positions" );
00091   MSQ_DBGOUT(2) << "\no  Performing Feasible Newton optimization.\n";
00092   
00093   //
00094   // the only valid 2D meshes that FeasibleNewton works for are truly planar which 
00095   // lie in the X-Y coordinate plane.
00096   //
00097 
00098   XYPlanarDomain *xyPlanarDomainPtr = dynamic_cast<XYPlanarDomain*>(pd.get_domain());
00099     // only optimize if input mesh is a volume or an XYPlanarDomain
00100   if (!pd.domain_set() || xyPlanarDomainPtr != NULL)  
00101   {
00102     const double sigma   = 1e-4;
00103     const double beta0   = 0.25;
00104     const double beta1   = 0.80;
00105     const double tol1    = 1e-8;
00106     const double tol2    = 1e-12;
00107     const double epsilon = 1e-10;
00108     double original_value, new_value;
00109     double beta;
00110   
00111     int nv = pd.num_free_vertices();
00112     std::vector<Vector3D> grad(nv), d(nv);
00113     bool fn_bool=true;// bool used for determining validity of patch
00114   
00115     OFEvaluator& objFunc = get_objective_function_evaluator();
00116 
00117     int i;
00118 
00119     // TODD -- Don't blame the code for bad things happening when using a
00120     //         bad termination test or requesting more accuracy than is
00121     //       possible.
00122     //
00123     //         Also, 
00124 
00125     // 1.  Allocate a hessian and calculate the sparsity pattern.
00126     mHessian.initialize(pd, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00127   
00128     // does the Feasible Newton iteration until stopping is required.
00129     // Terminate when inner termination criterion signals.
00130 
00131     /* Computes the value of the stopping criterion*/
00132     TerminationCriterion* term_crit=get_inner_termination_criterion();
00133     while ( !term_crit->terminate() ) {
00134       fn_bool = objFunc.update( pd, original_value, grad, mHessian,  err );
00135       MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00136       if (!fn_bool) {
00137         MSQ_SETERR(err)("invalid patch for hessian calculation", MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
00138         return; 
00139       }
00140 
00141       if (MSQ_DBG(3)) { // avoid expensive norm calculations if debug flag is off
00142         MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "  o  objective function: " << original_value << std::endl;
00143         MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "  o  gradient norm: " << length(grad) << std::endl;
00144         MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "  o  Hessian norm: " << mHessian.norm() << std::endl;
00145       }
00146     
00147       // Prints out free vertices coordinates. 
00148       //
00149       // Comment out the following because it is way to verbose for larger
00150       // problems.  Consider doing:
00151       //  inner_term_crit->write_mesh_steps( "filename.vtk" );
00152       // instead.
00153       // - j.kraftcheck 2010-11-17
00154 //      if (MSQ_DBG(3)) {
00155 //        MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "\n  o Free vertices ("<< pd.num_free_vertices()
00156 //                  <<")original coordinates:\n ";
00157 //        MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00158 //        const MsqVertex* toto1 = pd.get_vertex_array(err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00159 //        MsqFreeVertexIndexIterator ind1(pd, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00160 //        ind1.reset();
00161 //        while (ind1.next()) {
00162 //          MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "\t\t\t" << toto1[ind1.value()];
00163 //        }
00164 //      }
00165       
00166       // 4. Calculate a direction using preconditionned conjugate gradients
00167       //    to find a zero of the Newton system of equations (H*d = -g)
00168       //    (a) stop if conjugate iteration limit reached
00169       //    (b) stop if relative residual is small
00170       //    (c) stop if direction of negative curvature is obtained
00171 
00172       mHessian.cg_solver(arrptr(d), arrptr(grad), err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00173 
00174       // 5. Check for descent direction (inner produce of gradient and
00175       //    direction is negative.
00176       double alpha = inner( grad, d );
00177       // TODD -- Add back in if you encounter problems -- do a gradient
00178       //         step if the direction from the conjugate gradient solver
00179       //         is not a descent direction for the objective function.  We
00180       //         SHOULD always get a descent direction from the conjugate
00181       //         method though, unless the preconditioner is not positive
00182       //         definite.
00183       // If direction is positive, does a gradient (steepest descent) step.
00184 
00185       if (alpha > -epsilon) {
00186     
00187         MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "  o  alpha = " << alpha << " (rejected)" << std::endl;
00188     
00189         if (!havePrintedDirectionMessage) {
00190           MSQ_PRINT(1)("Newton direction not guaranteed descent.  Ensure preconditioner is positive definite.\n");
00191           havePrintedDirectionMessage = true;
00192         }
00193 
00194         // TODD: removed performing gradient step here since we will use
00195         // gradient if step does not produce descent.  Instead we set
00196         // alpha to a small negative value.
00197 
00198         alpha = -epsilon;
00199 
00200         // alpha = inner(grad, grad, nv); // compute norm squared of gradient
00201         // if (alpha < 1) alpha = 1;    // take max with constant
00202         // for (i = 0; i < nv; ++i) {
00203         //   d[i] = -grad[i] / alpha;   // compute scaled gradient
00204         // }
00205         // alpha = inner(grad, d, nv);          // recompute alpha
00206         //                              // equal to one for large gradient
00207       }
00208       else {
00209         MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "  o  alpha = " << alpha << std::endl;
00210       }
00211     
00212       alpha *= sigma;
00213       beta = 1.0;
00214       pd.recreate_vertices_memento(coordsMem, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00215     
00216       // TODD: Unrolling the linesearch loop.  We do a function and
00217       // gradient evaluation when beta = 1.  Otherwise, we end up
00218       // in the linesearch regime.  We expect that several
00219       // evaluations will be made, so we only do a function evaluation
00220       // and finish with a gradient evaluation.  When beta = 1, we also
00221       // check the gradient for stability.
00222 
00223       // TODD -- the Armijo linesearch is based on the objective function,
00224       //         so theoretically we only need to evaluate the objective
00225       //         function.  However, near a very accurate solution, say with
00226       //         the two norm of the gradient of the objective function less
00227       //         than 1e-5, the numerical error in the objective function
00228       //         calculation is enough that the Armijo linesearch will
00229       //         fail.  To correct this situation, the iterate is accepted
00230       //         when the norm of the gradient is also small.  If you need
00231       //         high accuracy and have a large mesh, talk with Todd about
00232       //         the numerical issues so that we can fix it.
00233 
00234       // TODD -- the Armijo linesearch here is only good for differentiable
00235       //         functions.  When projections are involved, you should change
00236       //               to a form of the linesearch meant for nondifferentiable
00237       //         functions.
00238 
00239       pd.move_free_vertices_constrained(arrptr(d), nv, beta, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00240       fn_bool = objFunc.evaluate(pd, new_value, grad, err); 
00241       if (err.error_code() == err.BARRIER_VIOLATED)
00242         err.clear();  // barrier violated does not represent an actual error here
00243       MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00244 
00245       if ((fn_bool && (original_value - new_value >= -alpha*beta - epsilon)) ||
00246           (fn_bool && (length(arrptr(grad), nv) < 100*convTol))) {
00247         // Armijo linesearch rules passed.
00248         MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "  o  beta = " << beta << " (accepted without line search)" << std::endl;
00249       }
00250       else {
00251         if (!fn_bool) {
00252         // Function undefined.  Use the higher decrease rate.
00253           beta *= beta0;
00254           MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "  o  beta = " << beta << " (invalid step)" << std::endl;
00255         }
00256         else {
00257           // Function defined, but not sufficient decrease
00258           // Use the lower decrease rate.
00259           beta *= beta1;
00260           MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "  o  beta = " << beta << " (insufficient decrease)" << std::endl;
00261         }
00262         pd.set_to_vertices_memento(coordsMem, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00263       
00264         // Standard Armijo linesearch rules
00265  
00266         MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "  o  Doing line search" << std::endl;
00267         while (beta >= tol1) {
00268           // 6. Search along the direction
00269           //    (a) trial = x + beta*d
00270           pd.move_free_vertices_constrained(arrptr(d), nv, beta, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00271           //    (b) function evaluation
00272           fn_bool = objFunc.evaluate(pd, new_value, err); 
00273           if (err.error_code() == err.BARRIER_VIOLATED)
00274             err.clear();  // barrier violated does not represent an actual error here
00275           MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00276 
00277           //    (c) check for sufficient decrease and stop
00278           if (!fn_bool) { 
00279             // function not defined at trial point
00280             beta *= beta0;
00281           }
00282           else if (original_value - new_value >= -alpha*beta - epsilon ) {
00283             // iterate is acceptable.
00284             break; 
00285           }
00286           else {
00287             // iterate is not acceptable -- shrink beta
00288             beta *= beta1;
00289           }
00290           pd.set_to_vertices_memento(coordsMem, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00291         } 
00292 
00293         if (beta < tol1) {
00294           // assert(pd.set_to_vertices_memento called last)
00295 
00296           // TODD -- Lower limit on steplength reached.  Direction does not 
00297                  //         appear to make sufficient progress decreasing the 
00298           //         objective function.  This can happen when you are 
00299           //         very near a solution due to numerical errors in 
00300                  //         computing the objective function.  It can also happen 
00301           //         when the direction is not a descent direction and when
00302                  //         you are projecting the iterates onto a surface.
00303           //
00304           //         The latter cases require the use of a linesearch on
00305           //         a gradient step.  If this linesearch terminate with
00306           //         insufficient decrease, then you are at a critical 
00307           //         point and should stop!
00308           //
00309           //         The numerical errors with the objective function cannot
00310           //         be overcome.  Eventually, the gradient step will
00311           //         fail to compute a new direction and you will stop.
00312 
00313           MSQ_PRINT(1)("Sufficient decrease not obtained in linesearch; switching to gradient.\n");
00314 
00315           alpha = inner(arrptr(grad), arrptr(grad), nv);        // compute norm squared of gradient
00316           if (alpha < 1) alpha = 1;     // take max with constant
00317           for (i = 0; i < nv; ++i) {
00318             d[i] = -grad[i] / alpha;    // compute scaled gradient
00319           }
00320           alpha = inner(arrptr(grad), arrptr(d), nv);   // recompute alpha
00321           alpha *= sigma;                 // equal to one for large gradient
00322           beta = 1.0;
00323 
00324           // Standard Armijo linesearch rules
00325           while (beta >= tol2) {
00326             // 6. Search along the direction
00327             //    (a) trial = x + beta*d
00328             pd.move_free_vertices_constrained(arrptr(d), nv, beta, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00329             //    (b) function evaluation
00330             fn_bool = objFunc.evaluate(pd, new_value, err);
00331             if (err.error_code() == err.BARRIER_VIOLATED)
00332               err.clear();  // barrier violated does not represent an actual error here
00333             MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00334 
00335             //    (c) check for sufficient decrease and stop
00336             if (!fn_bool) { 
00337               // function not defined at trial point
00338               beta *= beta0;
00339             }
00340             else if (original_value - new_value >= -alpha*beta - epsilon ) {
00341               // iterate is acceptable.
00342               break; 
00343            }
00344             else {
00345               // iterate is not acceptable -- shrink beta
00346              beta *= beta1;
00347            }
00348             pd.set_to_vertices_memento(coordsMem, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00349           } 
00350 
00351           if (beta < tol2) {
00352             // assert(pd.set_to_vertices_memento called last)
00353           
00354             // TODD -- Lower limit on steplength reached.  Gradient does not 
00355             //         appear to make sufficient progress decreasing the 
00356             //         objective function.  This can happen when you are 
00357             //         very near a solution due to numerical errors in 
00358             //         computing the objective function.  Most likely you
00359             //         are at a critical point for the problem.
00360 
00361             MSQ_PRINT(1)("Sufficient decrease not obtained with gradient; critical point likely found.\n");
00362             break;
00363           }
00364         }
00365 
00366         // Compute the gradient at the new point -- needed by termination check
00367         fn_bool = objFunc.update(pd, new_value, grad, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00368       }
00369 
00370       // Prints out free vertices coordinates. 
00371 //    if (MSQ_DBG(3)) {
00372 //      MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "  o Free vertices new coordinates: \n";
00373 //      const MsqVertex* toto1 = pd.get_vertex_array(err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00374 //      MsqFreeVertexIndexIterator ind(pd, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00375 //      ind.reset();
00376 //      while (ind.next()) {
00377 //        MSQ_DBGOUT(3) << "\t\t\t" << toto1[ind.value()];
00378 //      }
00379 //    }
00380 
00381       // checks stopping criterion 
00382       term_crit->accumulate_patch( pd, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00383       term_crit->accumulate_inner( pd, new_value, arrptr(grad), err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00384     }
00385     MSQ_PRINT(2)("FINISHED\n");
00386   }
00387   else
00388   {
00389     std::cout << "WARNING: Feasible Newton optimization only supported for volume meshes"
00390         << std::endl <<  "   and XYPlanarDomain surface meshes." << std::endl
00391         << std::endl << "Try a different solver such as Steepest Descent." << std::endl;
00392   }
00393 }

00396 void FeasibleNewton::terminate_mesh_iteration(PatchData &/*pd*/, MsqError &/*err*/)
00397 {
00398 
00399     //Michael::  Should the vertices memento be delete here???
00400   //  cout << "- Executing FeasibleNewton::iteration_complete()\n";
00401 }
00402   
00403 void FeasibleNewton::cleanup()
00404 {
00405   delete coordsMem; coordsMem = NULL;
00406 }
